explains: v. 对……轻描淡写；轻视，贬低

sentences.en: Aboard his plane, the secretary tries to downplay the importance of the budget votes.
sentences.cn: 在他的飞机上，部长试图淡化预算投票的重要性。

sentences.en: While excessive optimism can promote bad investment patterns, resulting in a real-estate "bubble," the report's writers downplay that potential outcome in that it has not yet occurred.
sentences.cn: 虽然过度乐观可能会助长不良投资模式，导致房地产“泡沫”的出现，但这篇报告的作者对这种潜在后果只是一笔带过，认为它尚未发生。

sentences.en: And I don't mean to downplay engineering at all.
sentences.cn: 我不是说要贬低工程工作。
